reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Omah apik is a small guesthouse that I can definitely recommend, we travelled all over Bali and Lombok and this was our favorite accommodation. Etha, the owner, really created something special here, the house is very well decorated with super comfortable rooms, private verandas and the most breathtaking view ever. Etha, Putu and the rest of the team do everything to make their guests happy, and their personal approach made us really feel at home, we stayed one full week! Breakfast is served in the common area, also beautifully decorated with old wood and funky furniture, and is very tasty, with fresh fruits, organic jam and eggs upon request. We were allowed to use the kitchen, and Etha also cooked every now and then, a very nice Indonesian buffet with products from the vegetable garden. The hotel is located a bit outside Ubud (you will be surrounded by sounds of birds, frogs and the neigbour's roosters) but staff is very helpful in organizing transport, we rented a scooter most days and would do the same again.
reviews.title: Best stay in Bali!

reviews.text: Go to Omah Apik if you want to enjoy the Balinese country side and rice paddies, if you want action you better stay somewhere else. Great value for money.
reviews.title: This is how it's done! Outstanding , amazing.... Close to perfection

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Nestled in a enclave amongst Ricefields and friendly welcoming neighborhood this place is an oasis of calmness and Indonesian hospitality. The owner and he team have packaged what I expected of comfortable clean funky and friendly setting. Breakfast is healthy and fitting with this place.... The staff does everything needed to ensure you have a pleasant stay. The area is safe and is approx 50 k away from ubud center however I recommend hiring a moped( 50 per day from hotel)
reviews.title: Everything's perfect
Wonderful!
reviews.text: I could go on and on about how great this place and its people are... My recommedationnisnto go and see for yourself .... We travelled for 2 months in Indonesia stayed in 17 different home stays 5 star hotels etc.... This is my # 1 by far.... I know quality when I see it and this is the real deal.... Party animals stay away please :)

This is not the first time I visit Bali, but staying at Omah Apik is really a unique experience. Rooms are designed with antique taste and very clean. Staffs are friendly and helpful, and the breakfast is superb! The view of paddy field is truly wonderful. The hotel can also assist should you be interested in several activities like trekking, cycling and rafting.
reviews.title: A nice B&B side by side a paddy field

reviews.text: Lovely place with a great atmosphere. The owner Etha is warm and the staff is very helpful and can help you with anything.
reviews.title: Clean room and good bed; 15 mins from Ubud centre.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We wanted to stay for just one night, but decided to extend our stay with one night. This B&B is 15 minutes from the centre, so if you want to stay in a hotel at the busy Monkey Road close to all shops and restaurants, then you should not stay at this place. You can rent a motorbike for Rph 50,000 or you can take taxi's to and from the B&B. The B&B can arrange pick up from the airport, if you wish.
reviews.title: Relax in nature

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I liked that the place was away from all the crowded bars and restaurants. Our room had a nice view over rice paddy fields and a pond.
reviews.title: A dream place to relax a few days

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The beds are great and the room has a half outdoor bathroom. The room is comfortable and clean.
reviews.title: True gem!
